gov.usgs.anss.cd11

Class SeriesGapLists

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.anss.cd11.SeriesGapLists

  • public class SeriesGapLists
extends java.lang.Object
    This keeps track of a series of gaps lists based on some series sequence

    • Constructor Detail

      • SeriesGapLists

        public SeriesGapLists(int ser,
              long seq,
              java.lang.String file,
              EdgeThread parent)
               throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        this creates a gap list with no gaps in it
        Parameters:
        ser - The series of the gaps
        seq - The starting sequence, set to -1 if unknown
        file - THe gap file to read and write backing this list, if nul do not use such a file
        parent - The EdgeFile to use for logging.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if file is not found

      • rcvAck

        public boolean rcvAck(int series,
             long lo,
             long hi,
             int ngap,
             long[] lows,
             long[] highs,
             java.lang.String tag2)
        this called when rcv ack come in and if we do not know where we are, we create a frameset with a whole range gap. We also trim our set to match the low and hi reflected from the other end.
        Parameters:
        series - Serias number
        lo - The low seq in rcv frame set
        hi - The high seq in rcv frame set
        ngap - Number of gap received
        lows - The low end of gaps received
        highs - the high end of gaps received
        tag2 - A tag to add to the SendEvents
        Returns:
        true if the low and high indicated a new frameset

      • setLastTime

        public void setLastTime(int series,
               int i,
               long time)
        Allow user to association a long time with this gap
        Parameters:
        series - number
        i - The gap index
        time - The time to associate

      • rcvGapSet

        public void rcvGapSet(int series,
             long lo,
             long hi,
             int ngap,
             long[] lows,
             long[] highs,
             java.lang.String tag2)
        This is for processing a gap set (ack) coming from the receivers where we are primary sender
        Parameters:
        series - series number
        lo - Low end of the frame set
        hi - High end of the frame set
        ngap - Number of gaps in lows and highes
        lows - The starting sequence for the gap (inclusive)
        highs - The endding sequenc of the gap (the last sequence received)
        tag2 - A labling tag

      • getGapBuffer

        public int getGapBuffer(int series,
               byte[] buf)
        return the gap portion of the ack packet (from # gaps through gap list)
        Parameters:
        series - Series number
        buf - User buffer to put the gap information into
        Returns:
        The length of the buf used.

      • gotSeq

        public int gotSeq(int series,
         long seq)
        the processing software calls this routine for each sequence received so it can be marked off any gap in the gap list. This trims the gap list when the gap are filled and splits gaps if the sequence is not on the end of a gap.
        Parameters:
        series - Series number
        seq - The sequence to consider for all gaps.
        Returns:
        0=expected, 1= new gap , 2= in gap low, 3=in gap high, 4=Split gap, 5= not in frameset,6=in frame set but not in gap
